result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristofer C. YINDRA was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is to provide a DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kristofer C. YINDRA

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
GUILTY plea entered to count 1, possess THC  2nd or subsequent offense.  Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in count 2.  Motion granted.
The Court comments and sentences the defendant to the Manitowoc County Jail for ninety (90) days, under the Huber Law, commencing on 12-09-14 by 6:00 p.m.
$518.00 court costs imposed, to be paid by 05-09-2015 or 10 days county jail for failure to pay.
The defendant is ordered to provide a DNA sample.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief. 
Minutes.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 12-01-2014 @ 3:30 p.m. BR-2.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty pleas entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 10-02-14 at 4:00 p.m.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Minutes.
Preliminary hearing is reset to 08-28-14 at 11:30 a.m.

Defendant in custody.  
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 08-27-14 at 2:00 p.m.  
Minutes.
Amended Criminal Complaint amends the probable cause portion of the complaint.
Re:  Possess THC 2nd and Subsequent Offense, on 08-02-14.

Defendant in custody.  
The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess THC and possess drug paraphernalia.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 08-18-14 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $500.00 recognizance bond with the condition that defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Bail not furnished.  Defendant refused to sign.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.  
Minutes.
